column1: a survey had been carried out or not. However, it was not the contention of the Petitioner
that the Respondents have never carried out a survey. In any event, whether a survey
was carried out or not becomes a disputed fact. When facts are in dispute a Writ Court
is reluctant to use its discretionary powers of Writ jurisdiction. In the case of Thajudeen
v. Sri Lanka Tea Board & another (1981) SLR 471, it was held
